DataElement.preferredName: Nasopharyngeal Cancer AJCC Edition 8 Pathologic Regional Lymph Node N Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the regional lymph node involvement for nasopharyngeal carcinoma based on pathologic findings using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to pathologic N stage of the nasal part of the pharynx, lying above the level of the soft palate.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The nasal part of the pharynx, lying above the level of the soft palate.:(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.

Concepts.definition: The part of the pharynx in the back of the throat, at and above the soft palate. The nasopharynx is continuous with the nasal passages.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pathologic; caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:One criteria of the TMN staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

Concepts.definition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: AJCC Based:Staging Criteria Based on American Joint Committee on Cancer System
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 1/8/20 tmt added Registration Status.; 1/8/20 Received permission from Brian Campbell to transfer ownership from CTEP to NCI Standards. Changed workflow from retired to draft new with permission from CTEP to reuse with AJCC TMN stage CDEs. mc 10/3/13

ValueDomain.preferredName: Nasopharyngeal Carcinoma American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 N Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A finding about one or more characteristics of nasopharyngeal cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system. Epithelial tumors of the nasopharynx are staged using this staging system. Mucosal melanoma, lymphoma, and sarcoma of soft tissue, bone, and cartilage are not included in this classification. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)_A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.__One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Nasopharyngeal Cancer pN3 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Nasopharyngeal Cancer pN3 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Nasopharyngeal cancer with unilateral or bilateral metastasis in cervical lymph node(s), larger than 6 cm in greatest dimension, and/or extension below the caudal border of cricoid cartilage. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Nasopharyngeal Cancer pN3 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Nasopharyngeal cancer with unilateral or bilateral metastasis in cervical lymph node(s), larger than 6 cm in greatest dimension, and/or extension below the caudal border of cricoid cartilage. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Nasopharyngeal Cancer pN2 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Nasopharyngeal Cancer pN2 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Nasopharyngeal cancer with bilateral metastasis in cervical lymph node(s), 6 cm or smaller in greatest dimension, above the caudal border of cricoid cartilage. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Nasopharyngeal Cancer pN2 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Nasopharyngeal cancer with bilateral metastasis in cervical lymph node(s), 6 cm or smaller in greatest dimension, above the caudal border of cricoid cartilage. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Nasopharyngeal Cancer pN1 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Nasopharyngeal Cancer pN1 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Nasopharyngeal cancer with unilateral metastasis in cervical lymph node(s), and/or unilateral or bilateral metastasis in retropharyngeal lymph node(s), 6 cm or smaller in greatest dimension, above the caudal border of cricoid cartilage. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Nasopharyngeal Cancer pN1 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Nasopharyngeal cancer with unilateral metastasis in cervical lymph node(s), and/or unilateral or bilateral metastasis in retropharyngeal lymph node(s), 6 cm or smaller in greatest dimension, above the caudal border of cricoid cartilage. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Nasopharyngeal Cancer pN0 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Nasopharyngeal Cancer pN0 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Nasopharyngeal cancer with no metastasis to regional lymph nodes. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Nasopharyngeal Cancer pN0 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Nasopharyngeal cancer with no metastasis to regional lymph nodes. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Nasopharyngeal Cancer pNX TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Nasopharyngeal Cancer pNX TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Nasopharyngeal cancer in which the regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Nasopharyngeal Cancer pNX TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Nasopharyngeal cancer in which the regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)
